docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
This package can be installed using conda (or mamba, a faster version of conda):

mamba install -c conda-forge kcalc

docs.title: Development
docs.text:
To create a development environment, you must have mamba installed.

A development conda environment can be created and activated with:

make env
conda activate kcalc

To format the codebase:

make format

To run the unit tests:

make test

To serve the documentation locally:

mkdocs serve

docs.title: calc_k
docs.text:
calc_k(dg: float, temp: float = 298.15) -> float

Calculate the dissociation constant (Kd) from the standard free energy of binding (ΔG).

Parameters:

  • dg (float) –

    Standard free energy of binding in kcal/mol.

  • temp (float, default: 298.15 ) –

    Temperature in Kelvin. Default is 298.15 K.

Returns:

  • float –

    Dissociation constant Kd in M.

Source code in kcalc/conversion.py 
def calc_k(dg: float, temp: float = 298.15) -> float:
    """
    Calculate the dissociation constant (Kd) from the standard free energy of binding (ΔG).

    Args:
        dg (float): Standard free energy of binding in kcal/mol.
        temp (float, optional): Temperature in Kelvin. Default is 298.15 K.

    Returns:
        float: Dissociation constant Kd in M.
    """
    return _np.exp(dg * 1000 / ((_const.R / _const.calorie) * temp))
